WorkItem.Description:
Rawr Models Spellpower as "HPS - Sustained"
 
This is an archaic model from BC and Classic, which's logic worked as follows:
 
1) Spellpower means that I heal more per heal
2) Therefore I need to cast less heals
3) Therefore I use less mana.
 
Ergo, Spellpower is effective at making my mana last longer.
 
In today's modern healing environment, healers are never missing a Global Cooldown, and reactive healing is all but dead.
This has several implications.
1) Overhealing is mostly irrelevant
2) You never cast less healing spells because you are *always* casting.
 
2) Spellpower has it's weight greatly skewed when it's treated as a hybrid "Burst" and "Sustainability" Stat.
 
The only time spirit, mp5 and intellect ("Regen" stats) Are treated as useful is when there is a difference between 
HPS Sustained and HPS burst, Because spellpower increases both equally, it's useless for compensating for any deficit between HPS Burst and HPS Sustained.
 
This would provide a much better means of evaluating gear in terms of it's impact on regeneration, especially with discipline's current obsession with spellpower.
WorkItem.Summary: [Feature Request.HealPriest] Option to Disable Spellpower as "Sustainability"

Comments.Message: Gotta say, the idea that spellpower doesn't increase sustainability seems really really silly.

Err, "Sustained", not "Sustainability".

In fact, that's probably the mistake you're making. It's not "Sustainability", it's "Sustained". It's the amount of sustained healing you can put out. It'd be obviously silly if it didn't include spellpower.
